junit.extensions
Class UniverseFileGenerator

java.lang.Object
  junit.extensions.UniverseFileGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
SelectionTestListener, junit.framework.TestListener
public class UniverseFileGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements SelectionTestListener

Generates a universe file that can be used to run the same set of tests one at a time (a less efficient method). Order of execution will be preserved when the test runner is run in prioritizing mode.

Version:
06/04/2004
Author:
Alex Kinneer

Constructor Detail

UniverseFileGenerator

public UniverseFileGenerator(java.lang.String universeFile)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Creates a universe file generator which will write to the given file. Note: You must call setSuiteName(java.lang.String) before adding this object as a listener to a test result or initiating execution of the test suite, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Parameters:
universeFile - Name of the universe file to be created.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is an error creating the universe file (it is aggressively created).
Method Detail

startTest

public void startTest(junit.framework.Test test)
Each time a test is started, write a line to the universe file that will cause the same test to be executed.

Specified by:
startTest in interface junit.framework.TestListener
Parameters:
test - Test that is about to be run.

startTestClass

public void startTestClass(junit.framework.Test testClass)
Each time a test class is started, write a line to the universe file that will cause the same test class to be executed.

Specified by:
startTestClass in interface SelectionTestListener
Parameters:
test - Test class that is about to be run.

finish

public void finish()
Notifies the file generator that the test suite is finished. The file will be closed and resources are released. The test number is also reset to 1.

setSuiteName

public void setSuiteName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the test suite that is being run. This is required to create the proper invocation information in the universe file.

Parameters:
name - Name of the test suite, including package qualifiers. This should be the same as the argument passed into the test runner.

getSuiteName

public java.lang.String getSuiteName()
Gets the name of the test suite that is being run.

Returns:
Name of the test suite, including package qualifiers.

setLevelClass

public void setLevelClass(boolean enable)
Sets whether the test case granularity is classes or methods.

Parameters:
enable - true to set the granularity level to classes, false to set the granularity level to methods.

isLevelClass

public boolean isLevelClass()
Reports whether the test case granularity is classes or methods.
